comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

pull_request.title: Fix #124812 Fix #124785 Fix #124777
pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [ ] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

* Fix #124812
* Fix #124785
* Fix #124777

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

The reasoning and circumstances I had in mind are pretty much identical to those of #124901.

Example pages:
```
! https://www.city.naha.okinawa.jp/ (2022-07-19)
! https://www.city.takamatsu.kagawa.jp/kurashi/index.html
! https://www.city.tokushima.tokushima.jp/
://www.city.*.jp/banner^$~third-party,image
! https://www.city.takamatsu.kagawa.jp/kurashi/index.html (2022-07-19)
##.bgkokoku
```

2. Screenshots

N/A (Covered by the original issue reports.)

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

issue.body:
Включите расширение AdGuard Extra в настройках программы.

---

Пользователям браузерного расширения нужно установить скрипт `AdGuard Extra`. Для этого понадобится браузерное расширение-скриптоприёмник `Tampermonkey`

Ссылка на `AdGuard Extra`
https://userscripts.adtidy.org/beta/adguard-extra/1.0/adguard-extra.user.js

После установки скрипта нужно будет зайти в настройки `Tampermonkey`, включить режим эксперта, переключить режим встраивания на `мгновенный` и перезапустить расширение:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8361299/62641343-07248e00-b94c-11e9-9775-9854a7922889.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8361299/62641299-f7a54500-b94b-11e9-8a83-885d89abbeec.png)

pull_request.title: Fix #124800 Fix #124797 Fix #124798
pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [ ] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

* Fix #124800
* Fix #124797
* Fix #124798

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

Upon analysis last night, it worries me that most `www.city.*.jp` sites would use *completely* different element trees and names, such that finding recurring patterns on more than 3 reported sites proved futile. And even then, `##a[rel=nofollow][href*="/ban/pub/default.aspx?"]` was one of only three 3-site patterns I could find.

Additionally, I'm adding `###fBanArea.floating` for the sake of `https://www.pref.saga.lg.jp/`

2. Screenshots

N/A (Covered by the original threads)

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [ ] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

* Fix #124793
* Fix #124779
* Fix #124775
* Fix #124774

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

The reasoning and circumstances I had in mind are pretty much identical to those of https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/pull/124901.

Example pages:
```
! https://www.city.fukuyama.hiroshima.jp/ (2022-07-19)

! https://www.city.kure.lg.jp/
! https://www.pref.fukuoka.lg.jp/
.jp/uploaded/banner^$~third-party,image
```

2. Screenshots

N/A (Covered by the original threads.)

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
Yes.
Screenshot-1: ![garten2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6276915/179948539-0103059c-3630-4d28-a6ba-40cd483fb433.png)

Screenshot-2: ![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6276915/179948763-fab27f85-d465-4053-a5e9-c2310329d58e.png)

https://gist.github.com/Morku/066dd535b7c3b807a9776d85a59b3ec5 Strangely, when I wait like 20-30 seconds it MAY appear. But also disappear again when scrolling around. When testing around, I can't say for sure, it's cause by Base filter. I can't reliable reproduce by disable filter one by one. But what works for sure 100% is disableing AG entirely. Whats also may be interesting, the issue is only with the "Flammendes Käthchen" page. The https://www.mein-schoener-garten.de/pflanzen/alpenveilchen/zimmer-alpenveilchen always works fine with AG and Firefox.

comment.body:
So it does not depend on source-point (which results in the mentioned class name not to be present).
Will check this evening when on my other device, hopefully I can reproduce.

To summarize:
Hidden elements are present in code, do not have **display: none**. **Visiblity: hidden** would result the boxes to have the same size (same for any **filter: blur**)

I guess it also happens when only Base filter and German filter are enabled (with Stealth and DNS disabled).

issue.title: RFE/C: Use tools to wholesale block highly-suspect TLDs
issue.body:
_N.B.: Not using template, as it doesn't seem to relate to suggestions.  If I missed something, I apologize! 🙇_

@AdguardTeam https://krebsonsecurity.com/2018/06/bad-men-at-work-please-dont-click/ & comments lists some tools that, w/ _very_ high probability, identify [TLDs](https://www.icann.org/registrar-reports/accredited-list.html) that are almost exclusively used for malware/spam/&c.:

- [ ] https://www.spamhaus.org/statistics/tlds/
- [ ] https://www.symantec.com/blogs/feature-stories/top-20-shady-top-level-domains & linked

There also seems to be a high correlation of NameCheap-registered TLDs w/ malware/&c, but that may be something handled better via AGDNS.

What d'y'all think?

comment.body: Also you may suggest to add a filter to block potentially dangerous TLD's to DNS/AG Home:)

Так же я не успела,но при обновлении страницы сегодня вылезло сообщение,в котором говорилось, что из-за устаревшей версии AdGuard, страница может работать неккореткно,но никаких уведомлений о необходимости обновлений мне не приходило. > При отключенном AdGuard как видно из скриншота, все просто крашится и Вконтакте вообще отказывается работать. ### Screenshots

issue.body:

@RT9nPrufovNeBudet 

I can't reproduce on YouTube, but the video ads on Twitch are blocked by AdGuard Extra.
Please read:

### ATTENTION

Users of the program for `Windows`, ` macOS` or `Android` need to enable the extension` AdGuard Extra` in the program settings.

---

Browser extension users need to install [AdGuard Extra extension](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra#how-to-install-adguard-extra) or `AdGuard Extra` script (this option may not work everywhere).

<details> 
<summary>Installing the "AdGuard Extra" script in the "Tampermonkey" extension:</summary>

To install the script, you need the browser extension script receiver `Tampermonkey`

Link to `AdGuard Extra`
https://userscripts.adtidy.org/beta/adguard-extra/1.0/adguard-extra.user.js

After installing the script, you will need to go to the `Tampermonkey` settings, enable expert mode, switch the embed mode to` instant` and restart the extension:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8361299/117170553-caaced00-add2-11eb-84c9-3cbe3676ab83.png)

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).
